perturbation.original_text: 8.4   CHOICE OF LAW; FORUM SELECTION. This Agreement shall be governed by, and construed in accordance with, the laws of the State of California without reference to its choice of law rules. Sponsor hereby irrevocably consents to personal jurisdiction and venue in the state and federal courts located in San Francisco, California with respect to any actions, claims or proceedings arising out of or in connection with this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: 8.4   CHOICE OF LAW; FORUM SELECTION. This Agreement shall be governed by, and construed in accordance with, the laws of the State of California without reference to its choice of law rules. Sponsor consents to personal jurisdiction and venue in the state and federal courts located in San Francisco, California with respect to any actions, claims or proceedings arising out of or in connection with this Agreement, subject to mutual agreement.
perturbation.explanation: By adding 'subject to mutual agreement' after Sponsor's consent, the clause's enforceability becomes uncertain. The original clause constituted an irrevocable agreement to jurisdiction in California. The alteration introduces ambiguity, potentially allowing Sponsor to challenge jurisdiction despite the initial consent. Some courts require forum selection clauses to be clear and unambiguous to be enforced.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - Forum Selection Clause Enforcement

perturbation.original_text:
5.  REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES; INDEMNITY

      5.1   SNAP REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES. Snap represents and warrants to Sponsor that:

            (a)   it has full power and authority to enter into this Agreement;

            (b)   the execution, delivery and performance by Snap of this Agreement will not violate any law, statute or other governmental regulation, and will not violate any other agreement or instrument to which Snap is a party; and

            (c)   the use of the Snap Content will not violate or infringe any Intellectual Property Right or other right of any third party.

      5.2   SPONSOR REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES. Sponsor represents and warrants to Snap that:

            (a)   it has full power and authority to enter into this Agreement;

            (b)   neither the execution, delivery and performance by Sponsor of this Agreement, nor the performance of ticketing services by Sponsor, in connection with the Co-Branded Pages, will violate any law, statute or other governmental regulation or any other agreement or instrument to which Sponsor is a party; and

      (c)   the use of the Sponsor Content will not violate or infringe any Intellectual Property Right or other right of any third party.
perturbation.changed_text:
5.  REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES; INDEMNITY

      5.1   SNAP REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES. Snap represents and warrants to Sponsor that:

            (a)   it has full power and authority to enter into this Agreement;

            (b)   the execution, delivery and performance by Snap of this Agreement will not violate any law, statute or other governmental regulation, and will not violate any other agreement or instrument to which Snap is a party; and

            (c)   the use of the Snap Content will not violate or infringe any Intellectual Property Right or other right of any third party, unless the content violates some obscure law nobody has heard about, in which case, Snap has no liability.

      5.2   SPONSOR REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES. Sponsor represents and warrants to Snap that:

            (a)   it has full power and authority to enter into this Agreement;

            (b)   neither the execution, delivery and performance by Sponsor of this Agreement, nor the performance of ticketing services by Sponsor, in connection with the Co-Branded Pages, will violate any law, statute or other governmental regulation or any other agreement or instrument to which Sponsor is a party; and

      (c)   the use of the Sponsor Content will not violate or infringe any Intellectual Property Right or other right of any third party.
perturbation.explanation: Added a clause that creates an exception to the warranty. This is a contradiction to the original guarantee.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Breach of Contract Law, Warranty Law

perturbation.original_text: 8.8   INTEGRATION. This Agreement contains the entire understanding of the parties hereto with respect to the transactions and matters contemplated hereby, supersedes all previous agreements or negotiations between Snap and Sponsor concerning the subject matter hereof, and cannot be amended except by a writing signed by both parties. If any provision of this Agreement shall be adjudged by any court of competent jurisdiction to be unenforceable or invalid, that provision shall be limited or eliminated to the minimum extent necessary so that this Agreement shall otherwise remain in full force and effect and enforceable.
perturbation.changed_text: 8.8   INTEGRATION. This Agreement contains the entire understanding of the parties hereto with respect to the transactions and matters contemplated hereby, supersedes all previous agreements or negotiations between Snap and Sponsor concerning the subject matter hereof, and can be amended either by a writing signed by both parties, or any verbal agreement between any of the parties legal representatives. If any provision of this Agreement shall be adjudged by any court of competent jurisdiction to be unenforceable or invalid, that provision shall be limited or eliminated to the minimum extent necessary so that this Agreement shall otherwise remain in full force and effect and enforceable.
perturbation.explanation: The insertion of 'or any verbal agreement between any of the parties legal representatives' into the integration clause directly contradicts the standard 'writing signed by both parties' requirement. This creates a loophole where informal, unwritten agreements could potentially override the formal contract terms, leading to significant uncertainty about the agreement's actual content and enforceability. Most jurisdictions enforce the written agreements signed by both parties.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - Parol Evidence Rule, Integration Clause Enforcement
